snippet: When it comes to forming government policy, lawyers and economists have great influence. But in Britain, behavioral scientists are gaining a seat at the table, too.
abstract: Richard H Thaler Economic View column observes that when it comes to forming government policy, lawyers and economists have great influence; points out that in Britain, behavioral scientists are gaining a seat at the table, too; explores the benefits that might emerge from this collaboration.
lead_paragraph: When it comes to forming government policy, lawyers and economists have great influence. But in Britain, behavioral scientists are gaining a seat at the table, too.
